title: Deutsche Bank hit by drop in fixed income trading revenues
text: Deutsche Bank’s fixed income trading unit trailed well behind rivals during the third quarter in the latest sign of the steep hurdles Germany’s biggest lender faces in its bid to turn round the fortunes of its investment bank. Revenue in fixed income trading — by far the biggest remaining unit of Deutsche’s downsized investment bank — fell 13 per cent year-on-year to €1.23bn. The decline is further evidence that Deutsche is falling behind its large US rivals which on average reported an 11 per cent increase in the metric.

The decline is further evidence that Deutsche is falling behind its large US rivals which on average reported an 11 per cent increase in the metric.
